description: Deploy generated MCP connector code locally with Cursor AI guidance (5 min with AI vs 20-30 min manual, 90%+ success rate)
time_savings: Reduces deployment from 20-30 min to 5 min
dependencies: Node.js or Python installed (depending on connector)
skills_required: SKL-075 (configured OAuth for Google APIs - if needed)
success_criteria: Connector added to Claude Desktop settings

steps.name: Copy generated connector code to local directory
inputs: Generated MCP connector code from TASK-TEMPLATE-006
outputs: Code files saved in local directory
steps.success_criteria: All connector files (server.js, package.json, README.md) present

steps.name: Open connector directory in Cursor AI
steps.success_criteria: All files visible in Cursor explorer

steps.name: Ask Cursor to explain setup steps
inputs: Prompt: 'Explain setup steps for this MCP connector'
outputs: Step-by-step setup instructions from Cursor AI
steps.success_criteria: Cursor provides: dependencies list, config steps, OAuth instructions

steps.name: Install dependencies
steps.success_criteria: npm install or pip install completes without errors

steps.name: Configure OAuth credentials (if required)
inputs: Client ID, Client Secret from Google Cloud Console
steps.success_criteria: OAuth credentials saved in .env, file in .gitignore

steps.name: Test connector locally
outputs: Connector running locally on specified port
steps.success_criteria: Server starts without errors, listens on port

steps.name: Add connector to Claude Desktop settings
steps.success_criteria: Connector appears in MCP Servers list

steps.name: Verify connection in Claude Desktop
steps.success_criteria: Connector responds to Claude prompts, functionality works

checklist.guide: Download from cursor.sh if not installed
MCP connectors use either Node.js or Python, check generated README
Gmail, Calendar, CRM connectors need OAuth - follow Google Cloud Console setup
Test with npm start or python server.py before adding to Claude
Test basic functionality after adding to settings
Never commit credentials to version control

performance_metrics.accessibility: Makes MCP deployment accessible to non-developers

cursor_ai_benefits: Explains setup steps automatically from README
best_practices: FASTEST deployment: 5 min with Cursor vs 20-30 min manual
Let Cursor AI guide you through setup steps
Test connector locally before adding to Claude Desktop
Keep OAuth credentials in .env file, never commit
Verify connection with simple test before production use
oauth_setup_connectors: Gmail MCP Connector - requires Gmail API OAuth
Google Calendar MCP Connector - requires Calendar API OAuth
Google Drive MCP Connector - requires Drive API OAuth
Other Google services - requires Google Cloud Console setup
non_oauth_connectors: Custom API connectors - may use API keys instead
Internal tools - may not need authentication
Read-only connectors - may have simplified auth

common_issues.solution: Check Node.js or Python version, update if needed, run npm cache clean
Verify Client ID and Secret in .env, check OAuth scopes in Google Cloud Console

common_issues.issue: Connector doesn't appear in Claude Desktop
common_issues.solution: Restart Claude Desktop app, check connector path in settings
Check connector logs, verify API credentials, test API access manually
Change port in connector config, or kill process using that port

cursor_ai_prompts: 'Explain setup steps for this MCP connector'
'What dependencies do I need to install?'
'How do I configure OAuth for this connector?'
'Why is the connector failing to start?'
'How do I test this connector locally?'
accessibility_value: Cursor AI makes MCP deployment accessible to non-developers - follow AI guidance even without deep technical knowledge
